text: [Music]
alright guys so today we're gonna be
talking about how to clean cast-iron
pans that have gotten some rust on them
or a little bit of damage so what we're
gonna do with this one is just scrub it
with some water and I have a little bit
of steel wool or one of these green
scrubby pads nothing crazy crazy
abrasive and what we do is we use a
little salt so I have there's the Morton
kosher salt which is pretty coarse
splash water decent amount a little salt
there and then just put my little green
pad and you just want to really get in
there and work out just get in like a
nice circular motion to see how water
dark this night just want to make sure
you rinse this really well until the
water is just coming off clear so I'll
wipe it down real nice pop it in the
oven just for a few minutes to dry off
you can leave it in there for you know
10 minutes 5 minutes just to get all the
moisture to dry out and see no rust but
it still has that raw metal kind of
shine to it so we'll let that thing I'm
hanging out for a little bit I have a
high smoke point very neutral oil like
vegetable oil or grapeseed oil something
has a high smoke point you don't want to
use olive oil or something that can go
rancid or has like big flavor in it so a
very neutral flavor oil place that down
on here real rag because it is a bit
warm so we're going to put a little bit
of oil into the cast iron what we're
doing when we put the oil on the pan at
high temperatures that the oil has a
chemical reaction it becomes not oil
anymore but a polymer and if you notice
and sometimes the bottom of the cast
irons will rust and so I like to lock in
the whole pan so it'll stay nice and
season then conditions throughout the
whole things you don't want to rusty
bottom you know so we'll put a little
piece of foil underneath
pop it right in upstairs down very
important to upsize down so I'll set the
timer for an hour and we'll come back
and we'll see what happens if you zoom
in here real quick you can kind of see
how that little bit of shine and that
raw look went away it doesn't have that
like almost blue silver metallic look to
it it almost just looks like a matte
black so you have a pan pan dried down a
bit it's ready I'm just going to put a
little bit more oil on it you know it
shouldn't rust at all any more than that
we seasoned it but the more and more you
do this the better you treat it over
time and the better it'll treat you
yeah board Appetit was that good yeah
I'll do it again
